intro: Spermacoce congensis, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, simple, and often hairy leaves, and it produces small, round, red berries that contain the seeds. Spermacoce congensis is typically found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
